DOC.brief_summary: The role Side Branch ( SB ) predilatation coronary bifurcation lesion percutaneous coronary intervention ( PCI ) still establish . The predilatation could potentially damage SB ostium vessel dissection , make subsequent wiring problematic . However , predilatation could eliminate SB ostial stenosis obviate need SB treatment main vessel stent implantation . The aim study assess random fashion periprocedural myonecrosis , complication rate time SB rewire group without SB predilatation .
DOC.brief_title: Side Branch Predilatation Strategy Coronary Bifurcation Lesion Stenting ( SBPS )
DOC.criteria: 1 . Inclusion Criteria Subject least 18 year age . Subject able verbally confirm understandings risk , benefit receive PCI true bifurcation lesion , he/she his/her legally authorize representative provide write informed consent prior study related procedure . Target main branch lesion ( ) locate native coronary artery diameter ≥ 2.5 mm ≤ 4.5 mm . Target side branch lesion ( ) locate native coronary artery diameter ≥ 2.0 mm . Target lesion ( ) amenable PCI balloon angioplasty side branch . 2 . Exclusion Criteria STsegment elevation myocardial infarction ( STEMI ) Noncardiac comorbid condition present life expectancy < 1 year may result protocol noncompliance ( per site investigator 's medical judgment ) . Subjects refuse give informed consent . Subjects left ventricle ejection fraction < 30 % Subjects moderate severe degree valvular heart disease primary cardiomyopathy Contraindications 12 month double antiplatelet therapy
